item.title: Patch a VMware ESXI host with the ESXCLI command and choose the right image profile
item.description: When installing a patch on a VMware ESXi host using the ESXCLI command you need to specify the image profile that is available in the ESXi patch. Here are the steps for patching a VMware ESXi host with the correct image profile: Go to the Customer Connect Patch Downloads page. Download the patch needed, In this example, I use ESXi patch VMware-ESXi-7.

item.title: VMware ESXi Broadcom data corruption problem with the tg3 driver. Check your environment!
item.description: VMware has released a new KB article (2072515) on possible data corruption with Broadcom adapters that use the tg3 driver. This problem can occur when: The system is configured with greater than 4 GB RAM TCP Segmentation Offload (TSO) is enabled on the adapter The system is running ESXi/ESX 3.5, 4.

item.title: Enable the Intel I217-V network card in VMware ESXi
item.description: The motherboard of my Haswell whitebox contains an Intel I217-V network card. See my “Haswell low power whitebox for ESXi and Hyper-V ” post for more information. The Intel I217-V network card is not recognized by VMware ESXi 5.x by default. On the VMware community I found a post with the Intel I217-V ESXi driver attached.

item.title: VMs with dropped packets %DRPRX
